    <h5>JavaScript is a programming language that adds interactivity to websites. It enables features like dynamic content updates, form validation, animations, and interactive maps. JavaScript runs in the browser, allowing real-time user interactions without reloading pages. <div class="sub font2">
    <h2 id="BE">Back-end</h2>
    <img src="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/3/30/Java_programming_language_logo.svg/1200px-Java_programming_language_logo.svg.png"width="255" height="255" alt="pic not found"><br>
    <h5>The backend of a website or application is the server-side part that handles data processing, storage, and management. It manages how the front end (what users see) interacts with databases and servers. Backend development involves languages like Python, Java, Ruby, and PHP, along with frameworks like Django, Node.js, and Spring. It also handles user authentication, APIs, and server logic. Essentially, the backend powers the functionality behind the scenes, ensuring everything runs smoothly<a href="https://builtin.com/software-engineering-perspectives/back-end-development">Back-end</a>.</h5>
    

<div class="sub font2">
    <h2 id="DB">Database</h2>
    <img src="data:image/png;base64,"width="255" height="255" alt="pic not found"><br>

<div class="end font3">
    <h5>A database is an organized collection of data that allows easy access, management, and updating. It stores information like user details, transactions, and content for websites and applications. Databases can be relational (like MySQL, PostgreSQL) with structured tables or non-relational (like MongoDB, Firebase) for flexible data models. They support operations like creating, reading, updating, and deleting data (CRUD). Databases are crucial for maintaining data integrity, security, and efficient performance in software systems <a href="https://www.oracle.com/database/what-is-database/#:~:text=A%20database%20is%20an%20organized,database%20management%20system%20(DBMS).">Database</a></h5>
